result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael R Renkas Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Credit for 1 day only if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 30 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 10 jobs per month and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.
The defendant may not consume or possess alcohol and no entry into any Class B establishments unless approved by the agent for employment purposes.
The defendant must submit a DNA sample.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

timeConds.notes: Huber allowed - can serve the jail time in any county in the State of WI but it is the ultimate decision of the Sheriff(s).
Must complete 40 hours of community service every six months.

supervisions.notes:
Same conditions as count #1 except no additional community service.
Concurrent with: Count #1

timeConds.notes:

Concurrent with: Count #1

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Michael R Renkas in court with attorney Chad Lynch.  Defendant Michael R Renkas in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 11:50 AM. Judge Habeck appears via video from Shawano County. Defendant Renkas and Attorney Lynch have no objections to the Court appearing via video. State has reviewed the revocation summary and does not see any inaccuracies. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - recommends on count #3 - 1 year in the WI State Prison System and on count #1 - 9 months in FC jail - concurrent to count #3 but consecutive to sentence that he is currently serving on 17CF06. Lynch - has reviewed revocation summary and makes final argument prior to sentencing, recommends on count #3 - 1 year in the WI State Prison System and on count #1 - 9 months in FC jail - concurrent to each other and concurrent to his sentence that he is currently serving on 17CF06 with credit for 140 days. Renkas makes statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: count #1 - 9 months in FC jail; count #3 - 1 year in the FC jail - concurrent to count #1 - consecutive to sentence on 17CF06 with 5 days credit, right to appeal, turn any unpaid fines into civil judgment, adjourned at 12:04 PM.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on May 24, 2017 at 11:45 am.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Defendant Michael R Renkas in court with attorney Michael Scholke.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:45 PM. Court has plea questionnaire, according to the PLQ form, the defendant will be pleading G to counts #1, #2 and #3 as alleged, counts #4, #5 and #6 will be DRI. Court informs defendant what is means for a count to be DRI. Court goes thru PLQ, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constititonal rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. Court dismisses and reads in counts #4, #5 and #6. Scholke - parties are free to argue for conditional jail time. State  - has complied with victim notification requirements ahd provides statement to all parties - makes final argument prior to sentencing - recommends on counts #1 and #3 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 3 years, concurrent to each other, with conditions of: AODA and follow thru, absolute sobriety, no entry into any taverns, bars or class B establishments, employment/school, 200 hours of community service, each count to have $10.00 fine plus costs, on count #3 - 180 days conditional jail, count #2 would be a straight sentence of costs only (not probation). Scholke makes final argument prior to sentencing - agrees with the probation on counts #1 and #3 but asks Court to not order conditional jail for stated reasons, asks for expungement under 973.015. State is opposed to expungement for stated reasons. Renkas makes statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: count #2 - $10.00 fine plus costs - take bond posted; counts #1 and #3 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 3 years, concurrent to each other, with conditions of: $10.00 fine plus costs on each count - take bond posted - any additional monies owed to be paid within 60 days/CO, maintain absolute sobriety, AODA and follow thru, no entry into a class B establishment unless the agent approves it for employment, maintain/obtain full time employment/school (10/30 hrs), submit DNA sample, 40 hours of community service every 6 months, 90 days conditional jail on each count - concurrent to each other - credit for 1 day only if revoked - report by 6:00 PM on 1/6/17 - can serve jail in any other county in the State of WI but it is the ultimate decision of the Sheriff(s), denies expunction, no possession of firearms, no voting rights, right to appeal, adjourned.
Substitute Service for GD by employer.

Attorney Michael Scholke appeared by phone means for Defendant Michael R Renkas. Prosecuting Atty Charles James Simono appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Michael R Renkas not in court.  Judge Habeck appears via phone means.  Matter called at 9:07 am.  Scholke - opening statement; believes client may not appear for trial; no contact for 10 days despite leaving messages, would like opportunity for oral arguments on motion to find out further information from client.  Simono - response, argues against motion.  Court - does not believe defendant's presence is needed at the hearing today; information in motion is clear, rules on motion, sides with the prosecution; motion denied.  Schoelke advises the Court of the strong possibility that his client may not appear for the trial; does not want to proceed with expense of calling in the jury.  Simono - response, advises that he would like to keep the matter on the calendar but not call in the jury.  Court - agrees; no jury, matter will be called at 1:00 pm when he will appear in person for another matter.
Motion hearing on November 28, 2016 at 09:00 am.
State's Response in Opposition to the Defendant's Motion for District Attorney Disqualification
Jury trial on November 29, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael R Renkas in court with attorney Michael Scholke.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:58 PM. Scholke - not resolved - client has rejected the offer and he is also aware of the ramifications in regards to rejecting the plea, attempted to consolidate the matters with a Marathon County case but not able to make any headway on that. State was not aware of that, the defendant has received two additional referrals in Forest County within the last two weeks that have not yet been charged. Court continues bond, sets for JT.  Jury trial scheduled for November 29, 2016 at 08:30 am.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Defendant Michael R Renkas in court with attorney Michael Scholke.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:55 PM. Scholke has complaint, waives reading of it, requests PH but will waive time limits for it. Court continues bond, considers time limits waived, set for PH.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 18, 2015 at 09:45 am.

Defendant Michael R Renkas in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:19 PM. Renkas states that he cannot call his attorney as he is in court in another county (Lincoln County) - Attorney Koppelman, Renkas asking for an adjournment so he can meet with his attorney. Court file does not have any attorney on record. Court will allow one more adjournment and if the attorney does not show at the next hearing - Court will proceed without him. Court continues bond and sets for AIA. Court gives ramifications of keeping adjourning the matter and appearing again without an attorney. Renkas understands.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 21, 2015 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant Michael R Renkas in court.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 9:30 a.m. Defendant handed complaint in court. Court reads charges, pentalties and right to an attorney. Defendant understands charges and idicates he has contacted an Attorney Kopleman, but was unavailable today. Court - Attorney Kopleman may appear by telephone. Bond continues.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 14, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
